title: After switching to AT and T I randomly get disconnect and my internet shuts down
body:
I will be happy to post logs if you want. After switching to AT and T I get disconnected. It happens about every 1/5 games. It's really annoying because people take the internet for granted and are quick to spam "Report him!!!!" after I dc.

I was with TWC for the longest time and this never happened to me. I'm on a 25 down / 5 up connection from at / t... it's pretty ridiculous that at / t has so many problems but these companies have monopolized the internet.

replies.body:
You're definitely right about people taking the internet for granted. Off the top of my head, this sounds like the new connection with AT&T might be routing your signal in a much different way than how TWC was if that makes sense? 

I'd like to get a picture of what your connection's health looks like after it leaves your home network by running a traceroute to our NA servers at 104.160.131.1. Let that run for a few minutes and post the results here for me to take a look!

Hmmmm alrighty. Most of that trace is looking pretty clean, but this line here makes me a little curious....

> 6 69 ms 55 ms 27 ms ggr3.la2ca.ip.att.net [12.122.128.9]

I'd try using a VPN to see if sending your connection along a different route could fix up that iffy spot, but it would probably be a good idea to give this data over to both ATT (to let them know there might actually be a problem with that node) but also shoot it over to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They may be able to look through your network logs a little more and spot something that could help you out in the meantime.
